intro: Meliosma venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan meliosma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. It is a small shrub or tree native to South America, particularly Venezuela and neighboring regions. The plant features simple, alternate leaves with a rough, often hairy texture on the underside. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically arranged in clusters, and it produces small, woody fruits that contain one or two seeds. Meliosma venezuelensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
